Package game

Class DoubleBonus710

java.lang.Object
game.DoubleBonus710
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameMode
public class DoubleBonus710
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameMode
DoubleBonus710 class represents the actual specific video poker game that is being played. In this case our game is a variation of jacks or better with a bonus payout for four aces.
Author:
Miguel Carvalho, Filipe Ferraz, Joao Baptista

    DoubleBonus710​(int playerCredit, int betAmount, int numberOfDeals)

    Constructor to initialize game object from an initial credit, a card and a command file (Debug Mode).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void initCommands​(java.lang.String pathToFile)
    This method creates a list with all the commands read from the command file (Debug Mode).

    This method creates a deck from the card file (Debug Mode).
    void initMatch()
    This method creates a match in which a player and a deck would be created.

    This method creates and initializes all the information of the player.
    void initSimulationDeck()
    This method creates a deck with all the 52 cards (Simulation Mode).
    void run()
    This method starts the full implementation of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • DoubleBonus710

      public DoubleBonus710​(int playerCredit, java.lang.String pathToCards, java.lang.String pathToCommands)
      Constructor to initialize game object from an initial credit, a card and a command file (Debug Mode).
      Parameters:
      playerCredit - Initial player credit.
      pathToCards - String representing the path to the card file.
      pathToCommands - String representing the path to the command file.

    • DoubleBonus710

      public DoubleBonus710​(int playerCredit, int betAmount, int numberOfDeals)
      Constructor to initialize game object from an initial credit, a bet amount and a number of deals(Simulation Mode)
      Parameters:
      playerCredit - Initial credit of the player.
      betAmount - Amount that will be bet in all rounds.
      numberOfDeals - Number of deals (number of rounds played).

    • run

      public void run()
      This method starts the full implementation of the game. In Debug mode, the program finish when all the commands are executed. In Simulation mode, the program finish when all the rounds are completed, after the statistics are printed.
      Specified by:
      run in interface GameMode
